name: Twin_Peaks_Timber_Players
text:
Twin Peaks Timber Players
The Twin Peaks Timber Players was a theatrical group in Twin Peaks, Washington.
History
The Twin Peaks Timber Players was first organized in 1974 by Leland and Sarah Palmer.
The group staged three plays every summer in the Twin Peaks High School gymnasium. The plays included 'Tis Pity She's a Whore, Brigadoon, There's a Girl in My Soup, The Paranormal Review, The Mousetrap, and Ask Any Girl.
At the time of his death in 1989, Leland Palmer was preparing to play the role of James Tyrone Sr. in the Twin Peaks Timber Players' production of Long Day's Journey Into Night.
